1.「ほおっ <pc>！ 来てくれたか。| ちーと 頼みたいことがあって| そなたを: Ho ho <pc>! You came. I was|looking for you for a favor.

2.「じつはな なんと……| 元の姿に戻る方法が 判明したんじゃよ！: And, lo and behold... we've figured out how to|get back to our original form!

3.「我が国に伝わる 古文書によると| 強力な へんげの呪いを解く 聖なる泉が| ジ:
According to an ancient document passed down|in our country, there is a sacred spring in a|place called the Jaira Jungle that can break|
|the powerful Henge curse.

4.「その名も クドゥスの泉じゃ。| そこに 身をひたせば かかった呪いが| たちま: Its name is the Fountain of Kudus. If you|immerse yourself in it, the curse will be|lifted instantly...

5.「この姿のままじゃと 国事をとりおこなうにも| 支障をきたすのでな。一刻も早く|: If I remain in this form, I will not be able|to conduct the affairs of state. We must|regain our human form as soon as possible.

6.「本来なら 城の兵士と ジャイラ密林へ行き| クドゥスの泉を 探すところじゃが|:
Normally, I would have gone with the soldiers|of the castle to the Jyla Jungle to search for|the Fountain of Kudus, but only a few people|
|know of my appearance.

7.「そこで 事情を知り ウデも立つ おぬしが| 護衛についてくれれば よいだろう…:
Minister Caboose agreed to escort me to the|hotel, saying, "It would be good if you, who|knows the situation and has the skills, would|
|escort me.

8.「どうじゃ？ デフェル荒野の北西にある| ジャイラ密林の クドゥスの泉まで| ワ: What do you think? Can you escort me to the|Kudus Fountain in the Jyla Jungle, northwest|of the Deferu Wilderness?

9.「おおっ。そうこなくっちゃ じゃ！| おぬしを見込んで 頼んでみて よかったわい: Oh. That's the way to do it! I'm glad I asked|in anticipation of you.

10.「そういうことで ワシは おぬしのあとを| コッソリ ジットリ つけていくぞよ。: That's why I'm going to follow you quietly and|quietly. Then, let's get going!

11.「おお。ありがたや……と 言いたいところじゃが| おぬし 他の者からの頼まれごと: Oh, thank you. I would say thank you, but you|seem to have your hands full with other|people's requests.

12.「それらを 速やかに片付けて| 急いで 戻ってまいるのじゃ。| ワシ ここで待っ: Clean them up quickly and hurry back. I will|be waiting for you here.

13.「おおっ <pc>！| 責任感の強い おぬしのことじゃから| 必ずや また 来て: Oh <pc>! I knew you would come|back again because of your strong sense of|responsibility.

14.「古文書によると 強力な へんげの呪いを解く| 聖なる泉が デフェル荒野の北西に:
According to an ancient manuscript, there is a|sacred spring that can break the curse of a|powerful moustache in a place called the Jaira|
|Jungle, northwest of the Deferu Wilderness....

15.「その名も クドゥスの泉。| その泉まで ワシを連れていってほしいんじゃ。: The name is the Fountain of Kudus. I want you|to take me to it.

16.「クドゥスの泉に 身をひたせば へんげの呪いが| 解けて 人間の姿に戻れると思う:
I think that if I bathe myself in the Fountain|of Kudus, the curse of hiccups will be lifted|and I can return to my human form. What do you|
|think?

18.「おぬしには デフェル荒野の北西の| ジャイラ密林のどこかにあるという| クドゥ: I want you to take me to the Kudus Fountain,|which is somewhere in the Jyla Jungle,|northwest of the Deferu Wilderness.

20.「ささっ <pc>。出発じゃ！| 心配せんでも ワシは おぬしの後ろを| ヒッソ: Well <pc>. Let's go! Don't worry,|I'll be right behind you.

21.「ふぉ……！ ここが かのクドゥスの泉じゃな。| 確かに 神秘的なニオイが プン: Whoo...! This must be the Kudus Fountain. It|sure smells mysterious!

22.「さて……。本当に 呪いが解けるかどうか| 確かめねばならんのう。: Now... we must see if the curse can really be|lifted.

23.「<pc>。ワシに もしものことがあったら| よろしく 頼んだぞ……。: <pc>. If anything should ever|happen to me, please give me your best|wishes...

25.「<pc>……。| これは ぬかよろこびだったようじゃ。| クドゥスの泉には な: <pc>... this was a blessing in|disguise. The Kudus fountain has no effect...

31.「むほー！ ワシは もうバケモノじゃない！| これで ワシは ワシはっ……。: Moo-hoo! I'm not a monster anymore! I'm not a|monster anymore!

33.「国王である ワシだけが……。| ワシが ふがいないせいで| 皆に 苦しい思いを: Only I, the king... who has caused everyone to|suffer because of my inadequacies...

34.「ゴリウス兵士長に 率いられた兵士たちと| 戦争に駆り出された まもの使いたち…: The soldiers led by Captain Gorius and the|messengers sent to war...where were they|taken?

35.「あの者たちも この泉に連れてきて| 人間の姿に 戻してやりたいのう……。| な: I wish I could bring them back to this|fountain and return them to human form... I|must find them somehow.

36.「<pc>！ ご苦労じゃった。| アラハギーロへ戻ったら 玉座の間まで| 来てく: <pc>! Thank you for your efforts.|When you return to Araghagirolo, please come|to the throne room. I would like to thank you.

37.「なん……じゃと……？ ワシの恩人が| そんな 非情なヤツじゃったとは……。: What...what...? I didn't realize my benefactor|was such a heartless man...

38.「でも ワシ おぬしの気が変わるのを| 信じて ここで待っておるからな。: But I'll wait here, trusting that you'll|change your mind.
